reviewText: Fantastic comedy that just about anyone can enjoy. Vicki and Carol and the gang are a wonderful ensamble of talent.
Title: Mama's Family Complete Seasons 1 & 2 DVD Set

reviewText: Always enjoyed this show on TV.  Really enjoying watching this show from the 80's.  So glad it was finally released on DVD.  Looking forward to the next season.
Title: Mama's Family Complete Seasons 1 & 2 DVD Set

reviewText: Note: This is just a combination set of the first two seasons, either of the seasons can be purchased individually.  You might want to check comparative pricing to see which buying option makes the most sense.Beginning in 1983, NBC brought the popular "The Family" sketches from The Carol Burnett Show to life with this raucous sitcom based on those unforgettable characters. In most cases, the sketch format never quite succeeds when extended beyond a few minutes (witness the slate of failed SNL movies), but there was something inherently relatable about the tacky and confrontational Harper clan that struck a chord with America. We could laugh at the over-the-top spectacle while still seeing the heart and truth underneath their wild shenanigans. The show lasted an impressive six seasons, and has lived on in perpetuity in syndication. Earlier efforts to bring Mama to the DVD market were met with enormous hostility by stalwart fans. The shows were in tatters thanks to the endless cycle of syndication which chopped both the witty introductions and major portions of the program from existence. Star Vista (in conjunction with Time Life) has sought to remedy this injustice with a recent Complete Series release reconfigured from the original Broadcast masters. And while the results may not be perfect (some musical numbers are still notably absent), this is probably as good as it's going to get. If you aren't able to pick up the financial burden of the Complete Series (current suggested price 199.95), Seasons One and Two have been dropped individually.The Season One release has all thirteen episodes spread over 3 discs with a couple of worthwhile Bonus Features:Bonus Content:1) Mama's Family Tree: The Branches Featurette: All About Eunice and Ellen2) Sketch (featuring Betty White) with the Family from a 1976 Carol Burnett ShowEpisode List:1) Vint and the Kids Move In, 2) For Better Or Worse, 3) The Wedding, Part One, 4) The Wedding, Part Two, 5) Family Feud, 6) Cellmates, 7) Mama Gets A Job, 8) Double Standard, 9) Mama's Boyfriend, 10) Fran's Dress, 11) Alien Marriage, 12) Positive Thinking, and 13) Mama's Silver.The Season Two release has all twenty-two episodes spread over 4 discs with a couple of worthwhile Bonus Features:Bonus Content:1) Mama's Family Tree: The Roots Featurette: All About Mama and Fran2) TV Movie "Eunice" from 19823) Vicki Lawrence Interviews Mama, Carol Burnett, and Betty WhiteEpisode List:1) Flaming Forties, 2) The Return of Leonard Oates, 3) Country Club, 4) Naomi and The Stork, 5) Rashomama, 6) Obscene Call, 7) Ellen's Boyfriend, 8) Aunt Gert Rides Again, 9) Amateur Night, 10) The Mama Who Came To Dinner, 11) Mama Learns To Drive, 12) Black Belt Mama, 13) Mama Buys A Car, 14) Supermarket, 15) No Room At The Inn, 16) Mama For Mayor, Part One, 17) Mama For Mayor, Part Two, 18) Harper Versus Harper, 19) Mama's Birthday, 20) Mama Cries Uncle, 21) Ask Aunt Fran, and 22) A Grave Mistake.The success of "Mama's Family," and its enduring popularity, rests with a great cast (many held over from Carol Burnett days). This was, perhaps, the role that defined Vicki Lawrence's career and will forever be associated with her. As the stubborn matriarch Thelma Mae Crowley Harper, it's hard to imagine anyone else donning that awful wig, strand of pearls, and housecoat (and I find it hilarious that the show actually won a Costuming EMMY). Of course, the majority of early storylines had Thelma contending with Vint (Ken Berry) and his new bride (Dorothy Lyman). Lyman became a terrific foil for Lawrence, their antagonism could be legendary. But the show also benefited from an extended cast that featured Rue McClanahan (Fran), Imogene Coca (Gert), Carol Burnett (who made her last appearance as Eunice in Season Two), and Harvey Korman (who made his last appearance as Ed in Season One). As a side note, it's great to see Korman's spiffy introductions as Alistair Quint returned to the DVD!In the end, "Mama's Family" is a nostalgic treat for those who loved it the first time around. It's silly, loud, and extremely tacky but also surprisingly lovable. I'm not sure new viewers will embrace it quite as much as those with a personal connection, but the truth behind the family conflict still has resonance. As I mentioned, this may not be the perfect release but it's markedly better than prior DVD iterations. KGHarris, 9/13.
summary: Mama's Back In A Better DVD Reissue: This Set Is Just A Combination Of The First And Second Season Individual Releases
Title: Mama's Family Complete Seasons 1 & 2 DVD Set

reviewText: I've loved Mama's Family ever since growing up in the 80s! And I think Vicki Lawrence is such a talent - love to watch her!And I love it when there is a great value: getting two DVD sets (two seasons) in one go! I already knew that when they re-released season 1, pretty much uncut, it was going to be a great product. Of course it's 100 times better than the first issuing! Love the extras too: The extras on season 2 are phenomenal, especially the Vicki and Carol interview!!!I really hope that the remaining 4 seasons will be released individually and soon! Buying the Time-Life complete series would be more expensive for me because they do not ship internationally and I'd have to bug someone in the states to worry about s+h to Finland :-/ So, as long as the remaining 4 seasons will be available individually (why wouldn't they???) I don't mind waiting!
summary: Love Mama's Family! Can't wait for the remaining 4 seasons!
Title: Mama's Family Complete Seasons 1 & 2 DVD Set

reviewText: I absolutely love, love, love this show!!! Did I say LOVE! The whole cast plays off one another to create knee slapping, belly aching laughs over and over again. What TALENT!! What COMEDIANS!! I will collect all of MAMAS FAMILY!
Title: Mama's Family Complete Seasons 1 & 2 DVD Set
